cyclone.name: FRED
cyclone.current_location: about 150 mi WNW of Havana, Cuba
cyclone.trajectory: Moving northwest across the east-central Gulf of Mexico, then turning north toward the northern Gulf Coast (FL Panhandle / southern Alabama).
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near the Florida Panhandle–southern Alabama coast

weather_observation.watch_coast: None in effect (interests from Mississippi to central Florida Panhandle urged to monitor).
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Northern Gulf Coast from Mississippi eastward to the central Florida Panhandle.
weather_observation.wind: Occasional tropical-storm-force gusts (25–35 mph) possible, but sustained winds at PortMiami are unlikely to reach gale force.
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected along the southeast Florida coast.
weather_observation.rainfall: 3–5 inches of rain possible through Monday, producing brief urban or poor-drainage flooding in the Miami metro area.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Increased rip-current risk and above-normal surf along Atlantic beaches; very low tornado risk.
